intro: Dendrotrophe buxifolia, commonly known as the boxleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in umbellate inflorescences. Native to parts of Africa, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
